description: From synchro- +‎ -scope, from syn- +‎ chrono- +‎ -scope, from Ancient Greek σύν (sún)+χρόνος (khrónos)+σκοπέω (skopéō)

entries.meaning: An instrument that indicates the degree to which two alternating current systems are synchronised with each other; used especially in electricity generation
An instrument used to synchronise the propellers of a twin-engine aircraft
